page.title: 03Petherwin Gate
page.content: In{1086 village}appeared{in Domesday {Book}under Devon.A tollgate used to be across the road.J.Ellacott is 90 years old he left school at 13 to work at home with his father a carpenter/wheel right.He could leave only if his attendance was good.He worked before and after school,pocket money was unknown.There was a butcher,policeman, postman and mason,only a postoffice/ shop serves the community now.He was in the navy during the 14-18 war,the village was not affected by the 1st.or 2nd. world wars.His family had a car when he was 21,the local doctor had the first car to be seen.God faring families did not work on Sundays. Mr. Mr.Ellacott wishes the family had moved away years ago for better job opportunities.The lanes were designed for horses.In 1911 the{DUKE OF BEDFORD sold the land to the public.
